author: sustainableada
title: Impact Measurement of SPOs
description: A key challenge with funded proposals is to track project progress + effectiveness with clear impact measurements, especially for Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

f6_assessments.q0:
Knowing the struggle of single stakepool operators trying to keep their nodes alive and limited delegators happy, while sustaining the operations finally, at first I was not convinced that the stakepool operators should even try to have any other social or environmental impact.

Yet, since Cardano has positioned itself as “the blockchain4good” (as the team puts it), it only makes sense to offer this tool for those stakepool operators and delegators who wish to focus on impact. Therefore, I would say this is well aligned with Cardano’s mission and the Fund9 strategic goals, especially that of real world impact. Finally, this is a great match with the challenge as it aims to make “the value of impact” more tangible.
f6_assessments.q1: Building on their earlier work, this team is bound to be successful. The budget they are asking for (15K) is minuscule compared to the value added. The plan is solid and detailed enough for this scope.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the tool is being developed in collaboration with chosen stakepool operators there is a natural accountability mechanism in place. The milestones are well thought-out and the KPIs are reasonable. The community can rest assured this will be implemented diligently.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal perfectly meets the challenge goals in terms of developing tools to calculate and value impact. The development of a model for the Impact assessment of companies provides a terrific way to evaluate proposals funded in previous rounds and examine whether or not they have delivered the promised results. Based on earlier work and research, the proposal highlights what is lacking in the present system and offers a simple yet powerful solution.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has demonstrated its ability to carry out this project through their delivery on previous funded proposal and they intend to further develop their SDG proposal tool. The draft development of their white-paper shows that they have already started on the project and have thought it through. Additionally, they have presented a reasonable timeline and budget breakdown for their proposal but it lacks details and clarity on the budget breakdown, it is basically a lump sum allocated to the KPIs. Instead of just allocating lump sum for content creation for example, clearly stating what the deliverables such as what type of content would be created, and then allocating a budget for each of those would help to better assess the budget breakdown.
f6_assessments.q2: The comprehensive timeline clearly explains what they wish to achieve at each phase which really makes it simple to monitor. Additionally, they have stated a clear method to track each of the challenge KPIs. However, there is no clear channel on how they intend to update the community and

f6_assessments.q0: The problem with funded proposal is non availability to track the progress of the proposal and also effectiveness with clear impact measurements. The proposer wants to resolve this by making a proposal impact measurement tool which will help define key performance indicator also measure and report it. This will be very helpful has many funded project has failed to deliver what they had promised and this will help track them. Thus increasing efficiency of the cardano ecosystem. hence this proposal do address the proposal effectively
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer team is Cardano AIM team made up of more than 200 Cardano community members. They have made many tools which have been very helpful for CA's and VCA's. It is safe to say they have the relevant skill and experience to carry out this proposal.
The Budget of 15000$ demanded for the work needed to be done seems very reasonable. They have provided a clear plan on how the proposal will be implement. They has taken in account of all possible risks. based on above observation it is very likely the proposal will be executed successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has given a very detailed step by step plan with a time horizon which would help auditors to audit the progress of the proposal. The clear budget breakdown will also be helpful in auditing. The proposal also consist of key performance indicator which will be useful. They have also included success measurement milestones with a timeline and have also provided Sustainable Development Goals all these will be helpful to track the success of the proposal. With all these things it is safe to say the information given should be sufficient to access the development and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described here in the proposal is in alignment with the challenge. Impact measurement is a very essential need of every project that runs in the Cardano blockchain and hence a need of this particular challenge.
Impact measurement makes it possible for Ada holders to evaluate the performance or effectiveness of the Stake Pool Operators through the impact measurement tool. This therefore when done in cardano would ensure SPOs deliver adequately and deal with funds carefully. The proposal therefore tackles the pain points of the challenge setting. A proposal of this nature has a great potential of shooting up the impact of SPOs and projects on Cardano in general.
The proposer has indicated that they would create a platform to share the impact of the tokens on DEXs…….. and hence will return to catalyst to be funded, that can keep the project sustainable.
I am very confident that the project is impactful.
f6_assessments.q1:
Information provided about the team is and their relevant experience and considering what they have already done and their individual experience and expertise, I think they are capable of executing the project. Three (3) items are described under the budget but there is less details on the items. The content creation item carries a cost of $7,500, however there seems to be a missing $1000 that will add up to the $5,500 and the other $1,000 to get the $7,500. This is really disturbing the feasibility of the budget. I will advise that more details of budget cost be provided when presenting a budget so that it can be assessed adequately. Though the budget appears unclear to some extent, I believe the amount requested is reasonable to execute the project considering the deliverables. There is a detailed plan and timetable. It’s good effort that the proposer has foreseen the possible risks that may arise during the implementation of the project and has provided measures to mitigate them. 
I will conclude by saying that the project is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap’s milestones and time horizon are detailed and comprehensive. The project is expected to take a time period of 17 weeks in which there are clear milestones for every week down through to the 17th week. 
The metrics/KPIs were wisely chosen  and I believe that they are good measure for measuring success as the results will indicate the number of SPOs onboarded and the number of community members using the tool to measure the impact of SPOs.
There is clarity in the problem described and I am sure that the proposed solution is effective to address the problem. The proposer has not specifically indicated the medium through which community members can track the project’s development: I will recommend that the proposer makes use of monthly or even weekly reporting to the data community channels on Telegram, Discord and the rest. I however believe the team would be sharing information about the progress of their project on their YouTube channel.
Considering all that have been stated above, I believe the project is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
SPOs are active players on the Cardano blockchain. Investors do stake their ADA in SPOs that neither the investors nor the community have an idea what real impact these SPOs are making. This, as the team proposes affect trust of investors and does not reveal transparency. 
A tool that will help investors or delegators and the community as a whole to measure impact will help build trust and transparency in SPOs. Sometimes it is just reassuring to know the impact that your investment makes in the society. 
This proposal addresses the challenge because they are creating an innovative tool that will operate on the blockchain and make massive impact as such. 
This proposed tool will also help other projects to identify and define their KPIs in a well understandable manner.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a detailed plan spanning about 17 weeks till the release of the tool. Milestones of this project are elaborated with timelines for execution. The plan also entails deliverables that are easy to understand and measure. The team members have years of experience in the Cardano ecosystem and have worked on project from previous funds so I don’t doubt their capability. Links to relevant skills and experience are also provided. 
The budget is well written and detailed enough to allow accountability. The funds requested is reasonable I think. 
I believe this proposal can be implemented successfully if funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs for this proposal are listed. They are clear and understandable and measurable. Success metrics have also been well elaborated to ease auditing. The budget as stated earlier is detailed and will allow accountability. 
I think this project is auditable

f6_assessments.q0: Being able to measure the impact of SPOs is a unique idea and can bring a lot of utility to other SPOs and community members. The current challenge suggested in this proposal is that there aren't enough tools that monitor the impact that these stake pool operators have on the Cardano ecosystem. Their proposed solution is to create a way that users can access this information and measure the impact that each stake pool has on the Cardano ecosystem. The idea behind this is to promote decentralization and to find stake pools that are providing the most utility to members. I would imagine that this is focusing on single stake pool operators. It may also decrease the amount of saturated pools by allowing these SPOs to reconsider and allow for more Cardano to be allocated to small SPOs. This could have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem because it will increase the amount of decentralization and give others opportunities. For these reasons, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars. The proposal can include information on how the team plans to include the community in this process.
f6_assessments.q1: I was impressed with the amount of details included in this proposal. To start, there is specific information on each of the team members behind this project. It includes their skills and highlights some of their accomplishments as well. This is important because it shows that the team is comfortable with the community knowing their identity. This also means that they are okay with being held accountable for their proposal. This typically increases the likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully. There are more details in order to determine this likelihood. The next section of the proposal I looked into was the roadmap. It was very specific and included dates and a timeframe of completion for each section. The project will last about 17 weeks. The specific timeframe will allow for the community to hold the team accountable for this project. There is also a detailed budget breakdown that explains where the team plans to allocate the funds. All of these details are very specific and informative. This helps lead to the likelihood of successful implementation of the proposal. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated above, there is a lot of information included in this proposal. There is an important product that the team plans to implement into the Cardano ecosystem. This will allow certain metrics and data points of stake pool operators to be measured. The team has included personal information in regards to the team's identity, skills, and accomplishments. There is also specific information in the roadmap and budget breakdown that allows the team to be held accountable. This is important because a community that looks forward to utilize this product will help keep the team accountable to launching their product within the 17 week timeframe. They will be able to help them along the way of development and even offer suggestions. I find it likely that this project will be successful if kept accountable. Because of this, I give this section 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The goals of this proposal and the goals of this challenge are well aligned. If successful this proposal would create a way to measure the sustainability of state pools on the Cardano Network. This information would be available to delegators so that they can make informed decisions about the efforts any potential stake pool is making towards sustainable development goals. This proposal has laid out in exact detail how they meet the goals of the challenge. But generally speaking, this challenge's main goal is to fund proposals that make a positive impact. In working to publicize sustainable information from stake pool operators, this proposal would have a positive impact on improving the sustainability of the Cardano network.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal will have a high degree of feasibility. The detail of the plan is sufficient to assess this at a score of 5. Their timeline is clear with a sufficient amount of detail to evaluate that they will likely be successful at completing this. Their budget is detailed and sufficient to accomplish the tasks laid out in the timeline. The team is well skilled  at accomplishing the various tasks that they plan. They also are partnering with other organizations which will enable Success. Overall this is a very feasible plan. The team is very well skilled, the budget is sufficient and I believe that this will be accomplished.
f6_assessments.q2: The goal of this proposal is clear. The metrics are good; they're planning to measure proof-of-concept trials which will enable the community to stay informed about what is happening on this project. This project will create a high degree of success for completing the challenge goals. This tool would be a real benefit to the  cardano community. I believe this proposal should be funded.

f6_assessments.q0: In my eyes the process of “impact value chain” is the following. Prove what you have done. Provide more information about its impact. Integrate this as an asset or merit etc. to the environment around you (trade it, hold it, let it increase your reputation in a domain or in general…). This proposal targets mainly the second step on the three step list above. The project builds a system to connect real projects and businesses to openly available impact criterias (like SDG) so that these projects can provide more information about the impact they have created. Finding effective KPIs that clearly demonstrates the impact and scales across many different types of projects, would certainly be a big help at measuring the impact and bringing it closer to the markets for monetization. The team has another proposal in this challenge which focuses more on commercializing the information about created impact. There are possibly synergistic benefits available from that.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project of impact measurement tools has already been going on since Fund 7. That gives some confidence to this endeavor. The roadmap has timelines and it explains well the plan of reaching out to the potential users as well as onboarding and educating them to the platform. However, technical aspects of the platform are not as clear to me. The development work of these tools could be described with more details. The same applies with the budget breakdown for  the content creation and development work. The total budget is told to be $200k. I see that this is for realizing this larger vision but much more clear information on the plan would be expected. 

The team working on this proposal has verifiably a lot of experience in the subject area. They have collaborated on this mission in the past as well. The technical implementation resources remain a bit foggy in my opinion.  

Focusing on SPOs is a smart idea also from a feasibility perspective. Blockchain infrastructure, which makes impact measurement, valuation and trading operations easier, is already familiar to them. Secondly, many of them are already quite oriented toward impact processes.
f6_assessments.q2:
The platform is going to be open source which is a great add to transparency. Because the roadmap, especially in technicalities, is not that detailed it is difficult to project the progress against that. Milestones and regular updates would make it easier to follow the work. 

For this specific project the success KPIs are quite natural and simple. That is the number of SPOs onboarded and proofs of concept performed. The amount of financial value derived from these impact projects by SPOs is a more challenging but accurate metric. I would add that, the observed financial market value of some asset is the collective “consensus or aggregated” price given by the markets at a certain point of time. It is not necessarily the fair value because understanding of these assets is not trivial yet. I find markets to undervalue these things. For this reason I would ask SPOs and other participants to evaluate freely their views on the financial potential created from their engagement on the platform.

The proposers talk in their whitepaper that only few proposals in their sample set are considering strategies for monitoring and evaluating impact throughout a project’s timeline. This proposal has the potential to lower that threshold and increase the number. Even though the scope of this proposal is to focus on SPOs, the growth in the number of projects which are considering impact measurements would be interesting to see again in the future.

solution: Creating the Impact Measurements Tool to help define KPIs, measure and report them, with a focus on SDGs impact for SPOs.
experience: 200+ team of active Cardano community members. Cardano AIM team (voter-tool, CA-tool, vCA-Tool, SDG Proposer Tool, SDG Search Tool). Globally diverse multidisciplinary team of professionals: Catalyst, sustainability and impact research. Fund 5,6,7,8 winners.
